gwt.ns.transforms.client
Class Transform

java.lang.Object
  gwt.ns.transforms.client.Transform

public abstract class Transform
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a 4x4 matrix for representation of affine transformations in three dimensions (using homogeneous coordinates). The matrix is "column-major," meaning that, in the multiplication of a series of transforms, the first applied matrix is on the far right. The translation values are found in column four.

The implementing structure is platform dependent. Where available, this class uses implementations of CSSMatrix for the speed of native-code matrix operations. Everywhere else, the matrix is simply a Matrix4x4.

inverse

public abstract void inverse(Transform dest)
Calculates the inverse of this matrix, if it exists, and stores it in dest. This matrix is not modified by this method.

Parameters:
dest - the destination of the inverse

inverseOrthonormalAffine

public abstract void inverseOrthonormalAffine(Transform dest)
Calculates the inverse of this matrix, assuming this is an orthonormal matrix + translation (e.g. concatenation of rotations and translations), and stores it in dest. Any perspective projection will likely have an adverse effect on the result. When this method is executed in pure Javascript, it is significantly faster than the brute-force inverse(Transform).

This matrix is not modified by this method.

Parameters:
dest - The destination of the inverse.

multiply

public abstract void multiply(Transform local)
Applies a transform in local coordinates to this matrix. Essentially, this=this*local.

Parameters:
local - The transform to apply.

multiply

public abstract void multiply(Transform view,
                              Transform local)
Sets this matrix equal to view multiplied by local, with view on the left and local on the right. This matrix is overwritten in process of multiplication, so should not itself be view or local. 
this = view*local

Parameters:
view - left-hand matrix
local - right-hand matrix

multiplyView

public abstract void multiplyView(Transform view)
Applies a transform in view coordinates to this matrix. 
this=view*this

Parameters:
view - The transform to apply

rotate

public void rotate(double theta)
Rotation in local (transformed) coordinates by angle theta.

Note: due to definition of screen coordinates (with +y pointing down), positive values of angle rotate clockwise.

Parameters:
theta - The angle to rotate, in radians

toFirefoxCss2dTransformString

public java.lang.String toFirefoxCss2dTransformString()
Create a Firefox-specific string representation of this matrix, suitable for the CSS3 matrix transform function property in that browser. Specifically, the last two values need units.

Returns:
A string representation of the matrixs values
See Also:
Matrix Transformation Function

transformX

public abstract double transformX(double x,
                                  double y,
                                  double z,
                                  double w)
Returns the x-component of the image of point (x, y, z, w) under the current transform. A w-value of 1 is generally used for points, 0 for vectors.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of point to transform
y - The y coordinate of point to transform
z - The z coordinate of point to transform
w - The w coordinate of point to transform
Returns:
The x coordinate of the transformed point

transformY

public abstract double transformY(double x,
                                  double y,
                                  double z,
                                  double w)
Returns the y-component of the image of local-space point (x, y, z, w) under the current transform. A w value of 1 is generally used for points, 0 for vectors.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of point to transform
y - The y coordinate of point to transform
z - The z coordinate of point to transform
w - The w coordinate of point to transform
Returns:
The y coordinate of the transformed point
